quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Submarine and Submarines
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, fiction, submarines. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The Kaiten was one of the deadliest midget submarines used by the Imperial Japanese Navy.
Some modern submarines have equipment capable of generating oxygen for their crew, by extracting it from water.
Which of these is a former name of Djibouti?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: French Somaliland

questions.question: Narcís Monturiol is credited for inventing the first mechanically powered submarine - Ictineu II. It used steam for propulsion and was originally designed to do this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ease the harvest of corals

questions.question: The Trident II SSBNs are among the most dangerous and destructive submarines -- each one carries a destructive power more than nine times greater than all Allied ordnance dropped during World War II.  What class of submarine is the Trident II?
This science fiction book was published in 1870 by Jules Verne, and described a submarine more advanced than any other at that time.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 20,000 Leagues under the Sea

questions.question: The first recorded military submarine was designed to attach explosive charges to ships in harbor and was called Turtle. It was invented by David Bushnell in 1775 and was operated by this number of crewmen.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Just one

questions.question: Which of these is a nickname of New Zealand?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The High Country

questions.question: Stefan Drzewiecki was the creator of the first submarine built in series - in 1881, 50 units were built for the Russian government. What country was Drzewiecki from?
Netherlands is often called ____________.
What is the nickname of Australia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Lucky Country

questions.question: Peoples Republic of Kampuchea is a former name of what country?
SS submarines use diesel-electric propulsion. What kind of propulsion do SSN submarines utilize?
Mesopotamia is the former name of  what country?
The design of modern submarines is called teardrop hull and is based on the hydrodynamic body of the whale. This was the first submarine to use a teardrop hull.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: USS Albacore (AGSS-569)

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Capital and State
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, east, waterfall. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What Indonesias former name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dutch East Indies

questions.question: What state capital was the temporary capital of the United States in 1783–1784?
What is the only U.S. state capital to border another country?
What is the largest U.S. state capital that is not the largest city in its state?
Basutoland is a former name of what country?
What is the name of the capital of the U.S. state of Kansas?
Niagara Falls isnt the highest waterfall in New York State.
What is a former name of Malawi?
What is the capital of the U.S. state in which Manchester is the largest city?
What is the only U.S. state capital that isnt the county seat of the county in which it is located?
What  state capital in the United States is nicknamed “The City Different”?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Santa Fe

questions.question: What U.S. state capital was founded in 1868 near the Salt River?
What is the capital of the U.S. state in which the largest city is Omaha?
What U.S. state capital has served as a state capital for the longest period, without a break?
Spanish East Indies is the former name of what country?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Massachusetts and Order
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, lakes, finger. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of the following is considered a Masonic symbol?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Both of these

questions.question: According to the 2000 Census Buffalo is the second largest city in New York. What city is number 3?
The seal of which of the following orders features two knights on a single horse?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Knights Templar

questions.question: What magical order was active in Great Britain during the late 19th and early 20th centuries?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Golden Dawn

questions.question: At which Massachusetts facility was the birth control pill first developed?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Worcester Foundation for Experimental Biology (Shrewsbury)

questions.question: Dan Browns best-selling thriller “Angels and Demons“ regenerated the interest in what secret society?
Among all 50 states, what unique designation does Massachusetts share with Kentucky, Pennsylvania, and Virginia?

options.text: They are the only states to have at least four native-born citizens who became Presidents of the United States.
They were the first four of the original 13 states to ratify the Constitution of the United States.
They are the only states defined in their constitutions as commonwealths.
They are the only states to have elected women to the U.S. Senate.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They are the only states defined in their constitutions as commonwealths.

questions.question: The book The Holy Blood and the Holy Grail, issued in London 1982, puts forward a hypothesis that Jesus married Mary Magdalene.
What organization was established after the American Civil War in order to fight for superiority of the white people over other races?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ku Klux Klan

questions.question: The cross and the rose were symbols of Rosicrucianism.
The novel Dracula was inspired by the Order of the Dragon.
Skull and Bones is a secret society at Harvard University.
What is the longest of the eleven Finger Lakes, located in Upstate New York?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cayuga Lake

questions.question: What fraternity is administratively organised into Grand Lodges?
Edward W. Brooke was Massachusetts first black U.S. Senator, and the first popularly elected black Senator in the country. To which political party did he belong?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Massachusetts and Town
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, massachusetts, peak. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of the following famous advocates of women suffrage was NOT born in Massachusetts?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Carrie Chapman Catt

questions.question: The so-called afflicted children, whose actions gave rise to the infamous Salem Witch Trials lived in which modern-day Massachusetts town?
Who was the first female Governor of Massachusetts?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jane Swift

questions.question: Which of the following U. S. presidents was born in Massachusetts?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George H.W. Bush

questions.question: Which beat generation writer, whose works include On the Road and Big Sur, hailed from Lowell, Massachusetts?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jack Kerouac

questions.question: Which one of the following Massachusetts cities and towns is not located in the county of the same name?
What is the highest peak in Massachusetts?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mount Greylock

questions.question: Which other state was originally a part of Massachusetts?
Which town is located at the southwestern corner of Massachusetts?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mount Washington

questions.question: Which one of the following distinctions does the Massachusetts Bay Transportation Authority (MBTA) hold?

options.text: deepest subway station in use in the world
oldest subway tunnel still in use in the United States
longest subway system in the world
most expensive subway fare in the United States

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: oldest subway tunnel still in use in the United States

questions.question: What is the name of the highest court in Massachusetts?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Supreme Judicial Court of Massachusetts

questions.question: Robert H. Goddard, a scientist born in Worcester, Massachusetts, is known as the father of what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: modern rocketry

questions.question: The Seven Sisters were a group of seven womens colleges in Massachusetts, Pennsylvania, and New York.  Which of these Massachusetts womens colleges was not one of the Seven Sisters?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Regis College (Weston, MA)

questions.question: What was the name of the New England Patriots from 1960 through 1970, when the team was part of the American Football League?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Boston Patriots

questions.question: This river, the longest in New England, runs north-south through western Massachusetts.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Connecticut River

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Capital and Country
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, country, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The Thames river is a major geographical feature of what capital city?
What Asian capital was known as the “Venice of the East?”
What capital city is on the southern shore of the Rio de la Plata, on the southeastern coast of the South American continent?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Buenos Aires

questions.question: The United Nations Secretary-General is appointed for a term of how many years?
The final point of the Dakar Rally, the capital city of Dakar, is located in hat country?
Who was the first UN Secretary-General?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Trygve Halvdan Lie

questions.question: It was from this Dutch castle that philosopher, playwright, and poet Hugo Grotius made his famous escape in a book-chest in 1621.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Castle Loevestein

questions.question: What Asian capital is located on the northwest coast of the Java river?
Which of the following songs is not one of the official state songs of Massachusetts?

options.text: Say Hello to Someone in Massachusetts by Lenny Gomulka
All Hail to Massachusetts by Arthur J. Marsh

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Massachusetts by the Bee Gees

questions.question: Amman is the capital of what country?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kingdom of Jordan

questions.question: What city is considered  the holiest for Judish, Jewesh, Islamic people?
Which European capital is home to major EU institutions?
The United Nations was founded as a successor of this organization.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: League of Nations

questions.question: The castle of Almourol is situated on a small island, in the middle of the Tagus river in which country?
How many emirates does the United Arab Emirates consist of?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: August and Country
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, headquarters, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Name the writer of the Star Spangled Banner and the star of the movies Blazing Saddles, Smokey and the Bandit II and Loose Cannons who were both born on August 1.

options.text: Francis Scott Key and Burt Reynolds
Francis Scott Key and Dom Deluise
Katharine Lee Bates and Dom Deluise
Adolphe Basile Routhier and Burt Reynolds

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Francis Scott Key and Dom Deluise

questions.question: Who is the Supreme Governor of the Church of England?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Sovereign

questions.question: A former US president, named William Jefferson Blythe III, was born on August 19, 1946.
In August 1965, this country, comprised of 63 islands including the main island, gained its independence from Malaysia that was ruled by Britain at the time.
August is designated as National Immunization Awareness Month.
What is the form of address to a king or queen?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: His/Her Majesty

questions.question: In August 1947,  this country bordered by the Arabian Sea on the west, the Indian Ocean on the south and the Bay of Bengal on the east, gained its independence from Britain.
What is one of the principal organs of the United Nations, headed by the United Nations Secretary General?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: United Nations Secretariat

questions.question: The United Nations headquarters building was constructed in New York City between 1949 and 1950 beside this river.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: East River

questions.question: Which of these is not an official language of the United Nations?
What is the form of government in the UK?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Constitutional monarchy

questions.question: How many countries signed the United Nations Charter in 1945?
The Sturgis Motorcycle Rally, which is held each first full week of August, originated in North Dakota.
The world map in the United Nations flag represents all the continents of the world.
When was the flag of the United Nations adopted?
